Typography

Use the typography component to visually style the default elements inside a container. The typography component is used mainly to style the content of a wysiwyg-editor without adding extra classes for each element.

Installation 

                  
                    npm i @govflanders/vl-ui-typography

or 

                  
                    yarn add @govflanders/vl-ui-typography

Usage

Import SASS 

                  
                  @import "vl-ui-typography/src/scss/typography";

Make sure your sass --include-path includes node_modules/@govflanders/.

Typography

Add a container with the .vl-typography class to apply wysiwyg styles to all child elements.

Lorem dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. Deleniti, in.

      
  <div class="vl-typography">
    <p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod <a href="#">tempor incididunt</a> ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat.     <p>Lorem dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. Deleniti, in.</p>
  </div>

Headings

Heading 1

Heading 2

Heading 3

Heading 4

Heading 5
Heading 6
      
  <div class="vl-typography">
    <h1>Heading 1</h1>
    <h2>Heading 2</h2>
    <h3>Heading 3</h3>
    <h4>Heading 4</h4>
    <h5>Heading 5</h5>
    <h6>Heading 6</h6>
  </div>

All headings can be styled using the .vl-typography class. If you wish to style headings without the typography wrapper, see vl-ui-titles instead.

    2. Lorem ipsum.
  4. Lorem ipsum.
      
  <div class="vl-typography">
    <ul>
      <li>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet.</li>
      <li>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit.</li>
      <li>
        Sublist

      <li>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur.</li>
      <li>
        Sublist
        <ol>
          <li>Lorem dolor sit.</li>

        </ol>
      </li>

    </ol>
  </div>

Markup

strong-tag

b-tag

em-tag

i-tag

strike-tag

s-tag

mark-tag

code-tag

pre-tag

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet. 

      
  <div class="vl-typography">
    <p><strong>strong-tag</strong></p>
    <p><b>b-tag</b></p>
    <p><em>em-tag</em></p>
    <p><i>i-tag</i></p>
    <p><strike>strike-tag</strike></p>
    <p><s>s-tag</s></p>
    <p><mark>mark-tag</mark></p>
    <p><code>code-tag</code></p>
    <p><pre>pre-tag</pre></p>
    <p>
      <hr />
    </p>
    <p>
      <blockquote>
        Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet.
      </blockquote>
    </p>
  </div>

Table

table title
head 1 head 2 head 3
item 1 item 2 item 3
item 1 item 2 item 3
item 1 item 2 item 3 
      
  <div class="vl-typography">
    <table>
      <caption>table title</caption>
      <thead>
        <tr>
          <th>head 1</th>
          <th>head 2</th>
          <th>head 3</th>
        </tr>
      </thead>
      <tbody>
        <tr>
          <td>item 1</td>
          <td>item 2</td>
          <td>item 3</td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td>item 1</td>
          <td>item 2</td>
          <td>item 3</td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td>item 1</td>
          <td>item 2</td>
          <td>item 3</td>
        </tr>
      </tbody>
    </table>
  </div>

.vl-typography provides styling for basic tables only. If you wish to use a more extended table, see vl-ui-data-table instead.

Accessibility

Avoid the <strike> and <s> elements because screenreaders ignore them. A possible workaround is to add invisible text (class="vl-u-visually-hidden") at the start and at the end of the content you want to strike, e.g. "start of striked text" and "end of striked text".
